entry.summary: Data Manipulation Olympics
entry.title: üõ†Ô∏è New Workflow: GTN Tutorial: Data manipulation Olympics - all steps and exercises

entry.summary: Scientific analyses often consist of a number of tools that run one after the other, in order to go from the raw data to scientific insight. Between these specialized tools, simple data manipulation steps are often needed as a kind of ‚Äúglue‚Äù between tools. For example, the output of tool A may produce a file that contains all the information needed as input for tool B, but tool B expects the columns in a different order. Or in genomic data analysis, some tools expect chromosome X to be listed as chrX, while others simply expect X. In these situations, extra data manipulation steps are needed to prepare files for input to analysis tools.
entry.title: üìö New Tutorial: Data Manipulation Olympics

entry.summary: The query for sars-cov-2 in SRA Entrez returns over 250K results, but only the first 20k are sent to the Run Selector. Enter the above query in Entrez directly to find the three runs used for the tutorial and send them to the Run Selector to send to Galaxy.
entry.title: ‚ùì New FAQ: Why does the query `SRR11772204 OR SRR11597145 OR SRR11667145` in the Run Selector not return any results?

entry.summary: This tutorial uses UCSC which is constantly updating it‚Äôs data! As a result it gets outdated very quickly before we can update it :( But it‚Äôs ok! It‚Äôs expected here to get different numbers.
entry.title: ‚ùì New FAQ: I got slightly different numbers than were in the tutorial

entry.summary: Please make sure you are logged in. At the top menu bar, you should see a section labeled ‚ÄúUser‚Äù. If you see ‚ÄúLogin/Register‚Äù here you are not logged in.
entry.title: ‚ùì New FAQ: My jobs are not running / I cannot see the history overview menu

entry.summary: Galaxy gets frequent updates, different servers will be running different versions. This is nothing to worry about, just let us know if you can‚Äôt find how to perform a task in your Galaxy.
entry.title: ‚ùì New FAQ: My Galaxy looks different than in the tutorial/video

entry.summary: This is a known bug with Chrome + Galaxy, we‚Äôre working on it galaxyproject/galaxy#11374. For now we can recommend using Firefox (known to work) or trying another browser.
entry.title: ‚ùì New FAQ: UCSC - I fetched data from a remote website but now I‚Äôm logged out of Galaxy and my data is gone?

entry.summary: The Galaxy interface has changed a bit recently, ‚ÄúAnalyze Data‚Äù was always the home button, and now looks like a home icon.

entry.summary: Overview
entry.title: üìö New Tutorial: A short introduction to Galaxy

entry.summary: This practical aims to familiarize you with the Galaxy user interface. It will teach you how to perform basic tasks such as importing data, running tools, working with histories, creating workflows, and sharing your work.
entry.title: üìö New Tutorial: Introduction to Genomics and Galaxy

entry.summary: Options for using Galaxy
entry.title: üñºÔ∏è New Slide: Options for using Galaxy

entry.summary: In this section we will look at practical aspects of manipulation of next-generation sequencing data. We will start with the FASTQ format produced by most sequencing machines and will finish with the SAM/BAM format representing mapped reads. The cover image above shows a screen dump of a SAM dataset.
entry.title: üìö New Tutorial: NGS data logistics

entry.summary: This tutorial aims to familiarize you with the Galaxy user interface. It will teach you how to perform basic tasks such as importing data, running tools, working with histories, creating workflows, and sharing your work.
entry.title: üìö New Tutorial: Galaxy Basics for genomics

entry.summary: What is Galaxy?

entry.summary: We stumbled upon a paper (Li et al. 2012) called ‚ÄúThe histone acetyltransferase MOF is a key regulator of the embryonic stem cell core transcriptional network‚Äù. The paper contains the analysis of possible target genes of an interesting protein called Mof. The targets were obtained by ChIP-seq in mice and the raw data is available through GEO.
entry.title: üìö New Tutorial: From peaks to genes
